description: Chevrolet Camaro Z28 . 2002 Hot Rod Magazine car! No expense spared on this build. Cars runs and drives perfect with lots of power. 502 Crate engine with B&M Powercharger. Full MSD ignition system. Engine made 651HP @ 5300 RPM and 777FT-LBS at 3800RPM. Have all the dyno sheets to prove it! Stahl custom headers with full 3 inch exhaust all the way to the back with two 40-series Flowmaster mufflers. Has a Richmond five speed transmission with McLeod dual-disc clutch. Moser Ford 9-inch rear end with a Detroit Locker. Has disc brakes all the way around with ladder bar suspension in the rear. Drive this car anywhere...street or strip! Custom cloth interior with 502 inlay in the door panels. Fully digital dash gauges with street and race settings. 1993 Jeep Gold Metallic paint in excellent condition. All the chrome is in great shape. Sad to see the car go but just don't have time to drive it. Catches attention everywhere you go! Please call if you have any questions! More pictures available upon request!

description: PRICE REDUCED BELOW $30K! FIRM BUT VERY FAIRLY PRICED...A LOT OF CAR FOR THE MONEY!
This is a great looking SE that just had had thousands invested in the mechanicals to get the car running and driving like a Charger should.

It is powered by a rebuilt 440 Magnum engine with a 750cfm Edelbrock 4-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock intake manifold and a stock manifold flowing out through a recently replaced dual exhaust with Flowmasters. Absolutely everything on this car mechanically has been gone through and repaired or replaced where needed. We have a full list of receipts upon request.

The exterior is done in red with the proper black stripes, black spoiler painted in flat black and all of the emblems removed except the original 440 6-pack emblems on the hood. All of the chrome is in excellent condition, it is fitted with the fog lamp option and the pop-up headlights are fully functional. The glass is all original and is in great shape. The car sits on new 17-inch Retro wheels with BF Goodrich high performance tires.

The interior of the car is in incredible shape from the dash to the rear, from the carpet to the headliner…just like you would expect a restored Charger to look. It is an actual factory air optioned car that has just had everything replaced and recharged to current regulatory standards to be serviced at any shop. It has power steering, power brakes, a full set of gauges which all work properly and the original push button AM radio. The console and dash really are in exceptional condition for a 1971…restored or not. The bucket front and rear bench are in perfect condition.
This is a very nice running and driving ’71 Charger listed at an affordable entry price of only $29,995.00 firm or $316.00 per month with 20% down and approved credit.
title: 1971 Dodge Charger

description: The 1971 Pontiac GTO is one of the last of a dying breed. With rising gas prices and more strict emissions standards coming down on the manufacturers, the classic muscle car was struggling to survive. This GTO though, put up a good fight against the changing times. The 400 CID V8 in this car was producing around 300 horsepower and had aggressive looking body lines. This GTO has a freshly rebuilt 400 engine that runs great and produces a ton of power. The body work was touched up and the interior was completely redone in 2004 including custom seats. In 2008 there was new suspension installed, bushings were replaced, and the car had a very nicely done paint job. If you are looking for a classic muscle car to take to shows or burn up some back country roads this GTO is a great choice for you. This vehicle is located in our Milwaukee showroom. You can view this 1971 Pontiac GTO in greater detail including HD pictures and an HD video of it running and driving at Gatewayclassiccars.com. If you are interested in purchasing this vehicle or have more questions regarding it please call us at (262)-891-4253 or email us at Milwaukee@gatewayclassiccars.com.
title: 1971 Pontiac GTO

description: This 1971 Oldsmobile 442 Convertible is for sale in our Louisville showroom. The 4-4-2 name derives from the original set up of the first car that debuted in 1964. The set up was just that a 4 barrel carb, 4 speed transmission and dual exhaust. Pretty much everything desired on your first generation muscle cars. Many people, even to this day, think that 442 is the cubic displacement of the motor but in all reality Oldsmobile never made a 442 CID motor.  They did however make a 400 cubic inch big block and in 1965 it was the motor of choice for the Cutlass 442 cars. Now, being that you could get an automatic, the 4-4-2 stood for 400 CID, 4 barrell, dual exhaust. Sales would steadily rise through the first generations 4 year span topping out at a tad over 25000 units. The 1968 model year would see the 4-4-2 become its own model and not just an option any longer. This numbers matching 71 is a great example of these timeless machines. This 71 has gone through a complete frame off 3 year restoration with and even has some pictures to show the progress. The window sticker, original bill of sale, build sheet, and protecto plate are included adding to the authenticity of this rare collectible. With only 10 miles on the build since its completion you can tell this beauty has been pampered since its rescue. The bright white paint with black stripes looks just like it did when it left the factory over 45 years ago. The white vinyl top not only works effortlessly but looks great against the extra slick paint. Pop the hood and the 340 HP 455 cid motor looks right at home, especially with the period correct blue paint on the block and valve covers. Mated up to the original turbo 400 this is one of the easiest driving big block muscle cars you ever drive. WIth the huge amount of torque being produced, these 442's were known for laying down some of the nasty burnouts. What this car was really made for, is top down cruising and this one exceutes that perfectly. The radial tires add to the smooth ride and with the luxury of power steering and power brakes you might forget youÃ¢??re in a 45 year old classic. Options on this 1971 Oldsmobile Cutlass 442 Convertible include; AM/FM radio, Power convertible top, power steering, power brakes, black vinyl interior, seat belts, and Radial tires with Factory Rally Wheels. To view this 1971 Oldsmobile 442 Convertible in greater detail, including an HD video, please visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com or our Louisville showroom. For more information on the 1971 Oldsmobile 442Convertible please call (812) 294-1555 Or email Louisville@gatewayclassiccars.com
title: 1971 Oldsmobile 442

description: Just Toys Classic Cars is proud to bring you another special Mustang to the stable.  You know that the owner J.R. is the resident Mustang nut of the shop.  He is very happy to bring you this 1971 Ford Mustang Mach 1.  This is a sweet looking car from 20 feet or 2 feet away.  The fit and finish on the car really stands tall.  The paint presents itself very well.  This car is a driver, so as always, we bring your quality cars, but this will have a rock chip or two because it has been driven and didn't just come out of the paint booth yesterday.  That said, this Mach 1 presents itself very well, and you would be proud to have it in your garage right now.      Now that this cool looking Mach 1 has drawn your attention to go look at it, pop open the hood and see that the 302 this car was born with is gone and a 351 Cleveland has been replaced between the shock towers.  This was the upgraded motor of choice in this era so this is a nice period correct upgrade.  This car is all business.  It was ordered back in the day with no frills that cost a lot of money back then.  No power steering, power brakes, or A/C.  However, with today's modern aftermarket parts catalogs that are out there, these things can be added to the car for not a lot of cost.  This motor runs very strong and will get you from A to B very efficiently.      Okay, so if you are a stang banger the way that some of us are here you just can't help yourself but to open up that driver door and slide yourself in to the comfortable seat.  Get yourself comfortable and get ready to hit that key.  You give the gas a couple pumps and turn that key over and you now hear that 351 come to life, and you hear that beautiful glass pack mufflers rumble out the back and you are going to have a hard time getting that ear to ear grin off of your face.  Throw the automatic shifter in to drive and get ready to go have a ton of fun, and get all the thumbs up that you can handle.      This car looks good, sounds good, and runs good.  The fun factor of this car is off the charts.  You can't be shy and drive this car.  We offer classic car financing for those of you that would like to take advantage of the offer.  They offer great rates and terms and allow you to pay of your sweet ride when you want to.  We look forward to speaking with you soon and we look forward to making you the newest member of the Just Toys Classic Cars family.      1971 Ford Mustang Mach 1 Blue Paint  Born 302, now 351 Cleveland   Automatic Rear Gears Unknown   Glass Pack Mufflers   4 wheel manual drum brakes   Manual steering   DISCLAIMER:    Before you buy any vehicle, sight unseen,  it is very important to ask as many questions as possible to make sure you are getting what you expect.  The majority of the customers that buy vehicles from us are very happy with their purchases.  We recommend that you should inspect cars in person before or have a professional appraisal company of your choice evaluate this vehicle and provide documentation
title: 1971 Ford Mustang

description: It's hard not to get excited about this ORIGINAL 1971 Dodge Challenger convertible. Under the hood is all stock, just as it left the assembly line, in fact, that’s the original factory paint you’re looking at! The engine is a 318 cubic inch V8 backed by a 3 speed automatic transmission. Add to this the power steering, power brakes, and grip of new radials all make this ragtop a fine Sunday driver. The interior features original black bucket seats, woodgrained steering wheel which matches the doors and the desirable center console. The odometer shows 65,551 miles and the instrument panel is full of original gauges, rare factory AC, working AM radio and sports a newer black convertible top. Recent mechanicals include new gas tank, new shocks, brakes and a fresh dual exhaust system that sounds great! This car is well documented and even has the original broadcast sheet! This well-presented survivor is hard to overlook. It's the kind of car that makes you get all nostalgic, and that's entirely the point of owning an American muscle car.
For more information or to schedule an appointment to view this car in person, please call us at 715-687-4522 or email us directly at kuyothent@gmail.com
title: 1971 Dodge Challenger

description: For sale at Gateway Classic Cars in our St. Louis showroom is a 1971 Plymouth Barracuda painted in Curious Yellow and powered by the infamous 426 Hemi.  Originally the car was powered by a 318.  Most would agree that the 318 is a great engine, to pull out and replace it.  What better engine to use than an original 426 Hemi from 1968.  In our minds, the best way to enjoy a Hemi is with a 4-speed.  Here you go, 4-speed transmission(new clutch and pressure plate) with a 3.91 gear set in an 8 3/4 rear end.  This makes for a very fun muscle car.  Equipment is minimal, but that seems appropriate for a Hemi powered muscle car.  It is equipped with power steering and an AM radio is in place, but why would you bother?  You have the music of the Hemi and a gas pedal for the volume control, that's all you need.  The paint will stop you in your tracks.  This is a very high quality paint job with hours upon hours of wet sanding and rubbing for a true show car shine.  Adding to the look is a set of MOPAR Rally wheels in 15" with modern radial rubber, Hemi Billboard graphics and a black vinyl roof.  Inside is standard Barracuda with black vinyl seats, center console housing the 4-speed shifter and an array of gauges.  The interior is only 4 years old and looks great.The Hemi is equipped with Keith Black pistons and rings, an oversized camshaft and headers.  This beautiful Hemi powered Barracuda is priced far below the real deal allowing you to enjoy one of the greatest muscle cars to ever leave Detroit.  Call 618-271-3000 for additional information or stop by our St. Louis showroom.  To view HD photos and video, visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com
title: 1971 Plymouth Barracuda

description: For sale in our Dallas showroom is a nicely done 1971 Ford Mustang Mach 1. Believed to be a number matching engine and transmission which is a 351 CID Cleveland V8 and 3 speed automatic transmission. The seller did change the intake manifold and carburetor to a 4 bbl instead of 2 bbl setup for the added performance. The rest of the vehicle is believed to be restored as it came from the factory. From the Grabber Yellow paint to the 8 track tape player. The front bumper was replaced with a chrome bumper for that fresh sparkly look. The engine has a rock solid idle and accelerates smoothly without a miss. The suspension is well sorted and handles nicely without worrisome noises. The interior was also done to completely original standards and fit and finish are great. If you are a fan of early 70Ã¢??s Mustangs then you should not pass up the opportunity on this one. The features include AM Radio with 8 Track, Power Brakes, Power Steering, Seat Belts, Vinyl Interior, Radial Tires, and Rally Wheels. For more HD Pictures and Video visit www.gatewayclassiccars.com/carlist2?src=2&location=DFW. For more information call our Dallas showroom at 817-310-9400.
